sentences.sentence: Our meal was a merry one. I have never known Holmes so brilliant.
He spoke on a quick succession( 一连串 ) of subjects, handling each as though he had made a special study of it.
His bright humor marked the reaction from his black depression( 消沉 ) of the previous days.
Athelney Jones proved to be a sociable person when off duty( 下班 ), and I was happy at the thought that we were nearing the end of our task, and caught something of Holmes’s excitement.
None of us discussed during dinner the cause which had brought us together.
When the cloth was cleared, Holmes glanced at his watch. “It is time we were off. Have you a gun, Watson?”
“I have my old service-gun in my desk.”
“You had best take it, then. I see that the cab is at the door—I ordered it for half past six.”
It was a little past seven before we reached the Westminster wharf( 码头 ), and found our launch( 汽艇 ) awaiting( 等候 ) us.
Holmes eyed it critically.
“Is there anything to mark it as a police-boat?”
“Yes, that green lamp at the side.”
“Then take it off.”
The small change was made, we stepped on board, and the ropes were cast off( 解开 ).
Jones, Holmes, and I sat in the stern( 船尾 ).
There was one man at the rudder( 舵 ), one to tend the engines, and two strong police inspectors.
“Where to?” asked Jones.
“To the Tower. Tell them to stop opposite( 在对面 ) Jacobson’s Yard.”
Our craft( 船 ) was evidently a very fast one.
Holmes smiled with satisfaction as we passed a river steamer and left her behind us.
“We ought to be able to catch anything on the river,” he said.
“Well, hardly that. But there are not many launches( 汽艇 ) to beat us.”
“We shall have to catch the Aurora, and she is known for being fast. I would like to explain my reasoning to you, Watson, now that we have a little time.”
“Please go ahead.”
“Well, after I had finished my chemical analysis, I came back to our problem of the Sholtos, and thought the whole matter out again.
I concluded that since Small had certainly been in London some time—as we had evidence that he maintained( 保持 ) a continual watch over Pondicherry Lodge—
he would need some time to arrange his affairs. That was the balance of probability( 盖然性权衡 ), at any rate( 无论如何 ).”
“It seems to me to be a little weak,” said I. “It is more probable that he had arranged his affairs before ever he set out upon his expedition( 远征 ).”
“No, I hardly think so. This lair( 藏身处 ) of his would be too valuable a retreat( 躲避处 ) for him to give it up until he was sure that he could do without it.
But a second consideration struck me. Jonathan Small must have felt that the peculiar( 奇怪的 ) appearance of his companion would cause people to associate him with this Norwood tragedy( 惨案 ).
He was quite smart enough to see that. He would want to get back before it was broad daylight( 大白天 ).
Now, it was past three o’clock, according to Mrs. Smith, when they got the boat.
People would be about in an hour or so: therefore, they did not go very far.
They paid Smith well to keep quiet, reserved his launch( 汽艇 ) for the final escape, and hurried to their lodgings( 租住的房间 ) with the treasure-box.
In a couple of nights, when they had time to see what view the newspapers took, and whether there was any suspicion( 怀疑 ),
they would make their way under cover of darkness to some ocean-going ship, where no doubt they had already arranged for boat tickets to America or the Colonies( 殖民地 ).”
“But the launch( 汽艇 )? They could not have taken that to their lodgings( 租住的房间 ).”
“Quite so. I reasoned that the launch( 汽艇 ) must be quite near, in spite of( 尽管 ) its invisibility.
I then put myself in the place of Small.
He would probably consider that to send back the launch( 汽艇 ) or to keep it at a wharf( 码头 ) would make pursuit( 追捕 ) easy if the police did happen to get on his track( 追踪他 ).
How, then, could he conceal( 隐藏 ) the launch( 汽艇 ) and yet have her available when wanted?
I wondered what I should do myself if I were in his shoes( 处于他的境地 ). I could only think of one way of doing it.
I might hand the launch( 汽艇 ) over to some boat-builder or repairer, with directions to make a small repair to her.
She would then be removed to his shed( 厂房 ) or yard, and so be effectively hidden, while at the same time being available at a few hours’ notice.”
“That seems simple enough.”
“I started at once in this seaman’s outfit( 全套服装 ) and asked at all the boat repair yards down the river.
At the sixteenth—Jacobson’s—I learned that the Aurora had been handed over to them two days ago by a wooden-legged man for some small repairs.
‘There she is, with the red streaks( 条纹 ),’ a worker told me.
Then Mordecai Smith, the owner, came down, drunk. I would not have known him, but he shouted out his name and the name of his launch( 汽艇 ).
‘I want her tonight at eight o’clock exactly,’ said he, ‘because I have two gentlemen who won’t be kept waiting.’
They had obviously paid him well, for he was giving shillings out to the men.
I followed him some distance, but he went into a pub, so I went back to the yard.
I met a boy who sometimes runs errands( 差事 ) for me on the way, and asked him to watch the launch( 汽艇 ).
He is to stand at the water’s edge and wave his handkerchief to us when they start.
We shall be waiting, and I trust that we will take both the men and the treasure.”
“You have planned it all very neatly, whether they are the right men or not,” said Jones, “but I would have had police in Jacobson’s Yard, and arrested them when they came down.”
“Which would have been never. This man Small is a pretty clever fellow. He would send someone on ahead, and if anything made him suspicious( 起疑心的 ), stay away for another week.”
“But why not follow Mordecai Smith?” said I.
“The criminals won’t have told Smith where they live. No, I have thought it over, and this plan is the best.”
When we reached Jacobson’s Yard Holmes took out a pair of binoculars( 双筒望远镜 ). “I see the boy,” he remarked, “but no sign of a handkerchief.”

Suddenly Holmes cried out, “The Aurora! And going like the devil( 飞快 )! Full speed ahead, engineer. Follow that launch( 汽艇 ) with the yellow light. I shall never forgive myself if she proves too fast for us!”
She had slipped unseen through the yard-entrance and passed behind two or three small boats, so that she had got her speed up before we saw her.
Now she was going at a tremendous( 极快的 ) rate.
Jones shook his head.
“She is very fast,” he said. “I doubt if we shall catch her.”
“We must catch her!” cried Holmes, between his teeth. “Heap it on, stokers! If we burn the boat we must have them!”

article_info.previous: 这一天警探Athelney Jones来访，他发现自己的推理有误而前来请求Holmes的帮助，Holmes回来时扮作了一个老水手，竟没有被Jones和Watson识破。而后Holmes对于搜捕行动提出了一些要求，警探表示配合。
article_info.share_words: I wondered what I should do myself if I were in his shoes. I could only think of one way of doing it. I might hand the launch over to some boat-builder or repairer, with directions to make a small repair to her.

options.cn: 这顿饭吃得非常愉悦，没人谈论公事。
options.en: It was a merry one and nobody talked about business.

options.cn: 因为Mr. Jones不太友好，所以这顿饭吃得很尴尬。
options.en: It was awkward because Mr. Jones was very unfriendly.

options.cn: 因为他们都为这起案件而烦恼，所以这顿饭糟透了。
options.en: It was awful because they were upset by the case.

analysis: 文中提到：“Our meal was a merry one. . . Athelney Jones proved to be a sociable person when off duty, and I was happy at the thought that we were nearing the end of our task, and caught something of Holmes’s excitement. None of us discussed during dinner the cause which had brought us together.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 在出发之前他们对汽艇做了点什么改动？
question.en: What changes did they make to the launch before setting off?

options.cn: 他们把整个汽艇刷上了黑色。
他们在顶上挂了一块手帕。
options.en: They hung a handkerchief on the top.

options.cn: 他们取掉了侧面的绿灯。
options.en: They took off the green lamp at the side.

analysis: 文中Holmes观察汽艇时询问：“Is there anything to mark it as a police-boat?”有人回答：“Yes, that green lamp at the side.”于是Holmes便说：“Then take it off.”因此答案选C。

question.en: What was the Aurora known for?

options.en: She was known for being fast.
She was known for being small.
She was known for being invisible.

analysis: 文中提到：“We shall have to catch the Aurora, and she is known for being fast.”以及最后Aurora出现也验证了这一点，“Now she was going at a tremendous rate.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 罪犯把他们的汽艇藏在了哪里？
question.en: Where did the criminals hide their launch?

analysis: 文中Holmes分析道：“I wondered what I should do myself if I were in his shoes. I could only think of one way of doing it. I might hand the launch over to some boat-builder or repairer, with directions to make a small repair to her. She would then be removed to his shed or yard, and so be effectively hidden, while at the same time being available at a few hours’ notice.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么Holmes不再继续跟踪Mordecai Smith？
question.en: Why did Holmes stop following Mordecai Smith?

options.cn: 因为Holmes在酒吧把人给跟丢了。
options.en: Because Holmes lost him at the pub.

options.cn: 因为他不会知道罪犯的藏身之处。
options.en: Because he wouldn’t know where the criminals lived.

analysis: 文中Holmes说道：“The criminals won’t have told Smith where they live. No, I have thought it over, and this plan is best.”因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第38天
